attributes.action: Erect statues of key workers & Medical staff in PPE, around the country.
attributes.additional_details: As a nation we are indebted to the key workers of this country who are bravely fighting to save lives, to feed the nation, to care for the vulnerable. This pandemic has shown who the heroes of this nation are, & they work tirelessly to save lives & to serve at risk to their own health & despite their own fears. This country should honour their heroism, fortitude & sacrifice. We as a nation are forever grateful to them, and forever proud of them. Let us celebrate them with statues in their honour
attributes.background: The nation is indebted to the key workers of this country who have risked their lives to save others and to keep the country running through a deadly pandemic. A statue depicting the key workers and NHS workers in PPE, should be erected to honour their self sacrifice and fortitude through this time.

rejection.details:
This isn't something that the UK Government or Parliament are responsible for. The erection of a statue would a matter for the local authority wherever the statue was to be located.

You could start a petition calling on the Government to provide funding to local authorities for the erection of statues of key workers and medical staff.

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here:

www.gov.uk/coronavirus
https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/

The Government has also created an online service to help you out what you can do if you’re struggling because of coronavirus: https://www.gov.uk/find-coronavirus-support

You can read NHS tips to help if you are worried about coronavirus here: https://www.nhs.uk/oneyou/every-mind-matters/coronavirus-covid-19-anxiety-tips

You can read impartial analysis of the Government response to coronavirus and policy developments here: https://commonslibrary.parliament.uk/coronavirus/

You may also be interested to know that because of the large number of petitions that have been started in relation to coronavirus, the Petitions Committee has been questioning the Government about its response to the coronavirus outbreak.
 
Find out more: https://committees.parliament.uk/work/192/the-governments-response-to-coronavirus/
